informal_statement: Show that for any natural number $n$, we have $11\mid 10^n-(-1)^n$.
informal_proof:
We have that $10 \equiv -1 \mod 11$, so for every natural number $n$,
$10^n \equiv (-1)^n \mod 11$. As a result, for every $n$ we have that $11$ divides $10^n - (-1)^n$.
formal_statement:
theorem induction_11div10tonmn1ton:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(11::int) dvd (10^n - (-1)^n)"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory induction_11div10tonmn1ton
  imports Complex_Main
begin

theorem induction_11div10tonmn1ton:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(11::int) dvd (10^n - (-1)^n)"
  sorry

end
